reviewText: Excellent look at the effects of global warming on the Animal Survival Story
We spent a week watching polar bears and native whaling. Another week driving from Fairbanks to Deadhorse and flying into Barter Island.  A great DVD.
Great story about a rare annual event.

You will see many fat, beautiful looking polar bears with their healthy, heavy off white fur in this documentary since many of them gather on the frozen shores of Barter Island, near the village of Kaktovik, to feast on the hunter-harvested bow-head whale remains. But meantime there are many that have to swim some unbelievable distance of four hundred miles in some ten days to reach the shrinking sea ice of the Arctic in order to hunt seals which offers the most nutritious food to these four hundred plus pounds carnivores in order for them to survive. Shrinking ice is a serious issue which is impacting the survival of this majestic animal.
